etymologies: Old English gors, gorst, from an Indo-European root meaning ‘rough, prickly’, shared by German Gerste and Latin hordeum ‘barley’

definitions: a yellow-flowered shrub of the pea family, the leaves of which are modified to form spines, native to western Europe and North Africa

examples.text: sheep graze on undulating green hills blooming with yellow gorse
on the 11th hole his drive ended up in a gorse bush

notes.text: Genus Ulex, family Leguminosae: several species, in particular the very spiny U. europaeus, which was introduced to North America

shortDefinitions: yellow-flowered shrub of pea family, leaves of which are modified to form spines, native to western Europe and North Africa
